## Getting started

This session assumes you have installed R and RStudio.

Install R for [Windows](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/).

Install R for [MacOS](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/)

Install RStudio from [Posit](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) and follow prompts for the appropriate operating system.

## What are Git and Github

Git is an open source version control software, local to your machine that tracks and records changes to your project. *Github is a* online interface that allows your to store, manage, and easily share your code.

![](figures/icons/git-github.png)

## You will need:

-   To have installed an updated version of R and RStudio.
-   To have installed git - this is critical you will not be able to pull the code from the online repository we work on without it.
-   To have a github account (free sign up)
